content: WASHINGTON, May 5 (Reuters) - US President Joe Biden sharply criticized 'MAGA' Republicans for their refusal to vote in a higher federal debt ceiling, signaling that there would be little compromise from the White House at a key May 9 meeting with congressional leaders.

Republicans are "divided" on the debt ceiling, Biden said, speaking ahead of a meeting on US investment at the White House, and so-called MAGA Republicans are pushing "draconian" cuts in the budget."The last thing this country needs ... is a manufactured crisis," he said. (Reporting by Trevor Hunnicutt)
